channel.title: Torrent Speeds
channel.description: Mine seems rather sluggish. I was wondering what everyone else's download rate was for your Torrent Client.

item.title: Torrent Speeds
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“mindtempest, post:28, topic:12798”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=18973.msg226078#msg226078 date=1157717151]
I get 60-70kb/s on seeded torrents(IE: 20+ seeds at one time) witch is my usual download speed but my upload speed is 20 BYTES per second, DO NOT BLAME ME, it’s my ISP. I can upload fine to anywhere else. My UDP is fine, I just can’t get a good upload speed on torrents. THANKFULLY I uploaded over 15GB and hardly download so I’m sure people won’t mind one leech that hardly downloads stuff.
[/quote]
how can you upload 15 gigs at 20 bytes per sec? that will take like 50sec per kb, translates to 14 hours per meg, 578 days per gig and 23.7 years for 15 gigs.[/quote]

Forgot to add before my ISP disallowed seeding torrents. It took about 2 days of seeding after I downloaded it, took 2 weeks(not every night though) to download it.

Read full topic

item.title: Torrent Speeds
item.dc:creator: @mindtempest mindtempest
item.description:
@mindtempest wrote:

frost21:

yea mine is like 20kbs usaully tops…my ports are blocked i think though, but to port forward dont i need the password for the router or something, since i dont know it, and my brother wont tell me =(

just go find the ‘reset’ button on your router and press it with a paperclip. then the pass will be reset.

and the highest i ever got for a torrent was 366 kbps. 66 kbps normal traffic and 3 ppls from my isp who forgot to set an upload limit and were uploading to me @ 100 kbps.
so if you want good speeds forward your bt ports, its much much better.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Torrent Speeds
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Alright so you have uTorrent. Make sure you do not have “Randomize port each time µTorrent starts” checked. You can uncheck that by going into µTorrent > Options > Preferences > Connections > Uncheck “Randomize port each time µTorrent starts”.

For the port, just enter anything in there above 10,000. I use port 16881. If you want, you can check Enable UPnP Port Mapping while in the Connections area.

Last questions. Do you see a Red circle with an exclamation point in the middle of it near the bottom of µTorrent? Look at this picture if you do not know what I mean. See the red circle with the exclamation point?
http://img372.imageshack.us/img372/9672/utorrentof8.jpg

That means your port isn’t forwarded properly on your modem. If not, go to www.portforward.com, click on utorrent, click on the type of modem you have, go to the URL of your modem, and enable whatever port you are using.

Are you sure you have UPnP enabled? Click on Start > Run > and type in services.msc and hit enter. Then enable SSDP Discovery Service if not enabled and set to auto. Then do the same to Universal Plug and Play if that one isn’t running.

If you still have a problem. Consult the µTorrent forums.
http://forum.utorrent.com/

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: Torrent Speeds
item.dc:creator: @crashe crashe
item.description:
@crashe wrote:

Ron:

What program are you using? What version of the program are you using?

uTorrent 1.6

What port are you using to connect to the internet? Most of the time it's 6881.
Umm.. whatever port was set up when I ran it... 35147. I don't know much about ports..
Do you have a software/hardware firewall?
Eh, Windows Firewall (XP SP2)
Do you have SSDP Service and Universal Plug n Play running?
UPnP, yes. SSDP? I don't even know what that one is..
Have you forwarded your ports?
Eh.. since I don't know, I reckon I haven't.
Any other information you can give would be great.

I’m on a wireless connection, and I don’t know where it is coming from. I just hooked it up and it was there. The network must be pretty far away though, as I rarely get above 100kb/s. But this may be due to time, because at night I generally get upwards of 200-300kb/s. (That’s not with a torrent… just downloading something)

Read full topic
